onClicked.name: onClicked
onClicked.comment: Fired when a context menu item is clicked.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

create.name: create
create.comment:
Creates a new context menu item. Note that if an error occurs during creation, you may not find out until the creation callback fires (the details will be in chrome.runtime.lastError).

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.create.callback Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in chrome.runtime.lastError.

Returns: The ID of the newly created item.

update.name: update
update.comment:
Updates a previously created context menu item.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.update.id The ID of the item to update.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.update.updateProperties The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.

remove.name: remove
remove.comment:
Removes a context menu item.

chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.remove.menuItemId The ID of the context menu item to remove.

removeAll.name: removeAll
removeAll.comment: Removes all context menu items added by this extension.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_app.ChromeContextMenus.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
